intro: Sipanea hispida var. major, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, with bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. The species is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant.
